subject: RE: [junit] How Junit will test all assert methods, even if one or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
msgSnippet: Good plan. Then we can get back to discussing important issues, like whether we should test ALL accessor methods! :-) But seriously ... while the FAQ is being
messageBody:
Good plan. Then we can get back to discussing important issues, like whether we should test ALL accessor methods! :-)

But seriously ... while the FAQ is being updated, can we get the accessor method issue addressed the same way in the FAQ? Something along the lines of "test or don't test the accessor methods, it's your choice!" :-) Some of us like to do that and some of us don't, both view points are valid and both should be accepted/respected. But it might be good to have that explained really well in the FAQ to help the signal/noise ratio. (That being said, the signal/noise ratio around here is far in favour of signal! :-)

Simon

-----------------------------------------------------------------
Simon P. Chappell simon.chappell@...
Java Programming Specialist www.landsend.com
Lands' End, Inc. (608) 935-4526

>even if one
>or more assert methods fails in a TestCase?
>
>
>> Hmmm, a lot of ink has been spilled on this question on this list.
>> While I don't object to your message Alexander, I'd like to motion
>> that we collectively refrain from reopening this discussion.
>
>Seconded. Let's handle this one really well in the FAQ, including all
>opinions, and point future instances of the question to the FAQ.
>
